intro: Genista demarcoi, commonly known as the Maricopa bursch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
